CatDescriptText: Mrs. Malvee Turner, laboratory technician, 1627 Sandusky Street, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 8, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "Which of these sources of leadership do you believe Negroes generally follow: church, labor, or politics? Why?" answer reads: "I think that the majority of the people follow the politicians, because the former are not capable of thinking for themselves.  Some of those persons who don't think for themselves also follow so-called religious leaders who have processed hair and other obnoxious characteristics."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Malvee Turner wearing light colored coat with rounded collar and dark gloves, holding paper bag, standing on corner of Fifth and Liberty Avenues, May Building with Thrift Drugs and Kappels stores in background, Downtown
